qas.question: What 1981 court decision added to the power of HCPs and ITPs for conservation?

answers.text: Palila v. Hawaii Department of Land and Natural Resources

qas.question: Who wrote the article "Searching for Consensus and Predictability: Habitat Conservation Planning under the Endangered Species Act of 1973."
What did Thornton compare the scientific and legal advances to, from the viewpoint of the development community?
When did private lands start to have more recognition?
Who ruled on the Palila v. Hawaii Department of Land and Natural Resources?
What did Thornton say the role of private lands was like for the development community?
When was the Environmental Law magazine started?

plausible_answers.text: Palila v. Hawaii Department of Land and Natural Resources

context: Growing scientific recognition of the role of private lands for endangered species recovery and the landmark <b3_0>1981<b3_0/> court decision in <a0_0><b7_0>Palila v. Hawaii Department of Land and Natural Resources<b7_0/><a0_0/> both contributed to making Habitat Conservation Plans/ Incidental Take Permits "a major force for wildlife conservation and <a2_0><b5_0>a major headache<b5_0/><a2_0/> to the development community", wrote <a1_0><b4_0>Robert D.Thornton<b4_0/><a1_0/> in the <b6_0>1991<b6_0/> Environmental Law article, Searching for Consensus and Predictability: Habitat Conservation Planning under the Endangered Species Act of 1973.
